segments.text: Ok , I ’ Ve got an up-to-day map . Let ’ s check the route from here to the airport .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Where are we ? Oh , here we are . So we drive to the A120 and turn left .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: No , we turn right . Remember that we are coming from this direction .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Oh yes ! Sorry ! Then we drive to the M11 motorway .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: It ’ s only seven miles . We turn left to join the motorway and drive south .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: According to the map , we get off the M11 at the second junction and join the M25 . That ’ s the motorway that goes around the edge of London .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That ’ s another 15 miles , so that ’ s 22 miles total so far .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Then we drive west on the M25 . we must be careful to turn in the right direction !
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Then we drive on the M25 . it turns south . When we reach exit 15 , we turn left and go west along the M4 .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Then we take the first Heathrow Airport . What ’ s the total distance ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: The journey around the M25 is 33 miles and then 3 extra miles to get to the airport . So how many miles is that together ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: 22 miles to the M25 , 33 miles on the M25 , and 3 after that . That ’ s a total of 58 miles , isn ’ t it ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: It shouldn ’ t take us very long to cover that distance . Remember that we can go quite fast on the motor way .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: We can only go fast on the motor ways if there isn ’ t much traffic . I think we should allow ourselves plenty of time to get there . Being early is much better than being late .
segments.speaker: S1
